title_sort: louisa van velsor whitman to walt whitman, 10 october [1871]
title: Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, 10 October [1871]
text: 10 Oct '71tuesdayTuesday morning Oc 10 My dear waltWalti had company yesterday so i didentdidn't write to you we had aunt freelove sFreelove's daughter elizabethElizabeth with an other lady here yesterday i got your letter this morning and i got three last week i dontdon't know what i would doodo waltWalt if it wasentwasn't for you to think of me it seems as if all the other sons and daughters has their own to attend to which is perfectly natural) georgeGeorge and loo and Jeff insists on my breaking up houskeepinghousekeeping they didentdidn't only insist but almost commanded me i told them i should remain here this winter if i lived) they none of them want eddEdd walterWalter and they would soon get tired of paying his board) and we aintain't much expenceexpense to any but but you walterWalter dear for any thing but houseroom at any rate i shantshan't break up as long as i can get around if i lose the use of my limbs altogether then i wontwon't object i suppose they do it for the best they think i live so lonesome) but waltWalt dontdon't worry about me breaking up i have had my way as eddEdd says to long)i had a letter from loo since they went home jimmy behaved very well while they was away but after they got home he stayed out late and on wensdayWednesday night he was out all night he went to a political meeting and the band of music atractedattracted him he said he slept in the alley but loo seems to have great patience with him she said he took on and cried and promised to not do so any more he would only be a good boy)walt i have a poem by Jean Bruce Washburn of the yo semiteYosemite valley californiaCalifornia mrsMrs. stantonsStanton's aunt i think its beautiful its a small pamphlet i will send it to you if you wish walterWalter write walterWalter if you would like itthe old indianIndian tradition i think is so beautifulthe fire in the woods on the prairie is awfull to read Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, 10 October [1871]
